solution.p: The equation is quadratic. We solve by extraction of roots. \begin{aligned}[t] 231.90 \amp = 18.85 r^2 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Isolate the squared expression.}}\\ 12.302 \amp = r^2 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Take square roots.}}\\ r \amp = 35 \end{aligned}

We must first get the variable out of the denominator. \begin{aligned}[t] n(2.8125) \amp = \dfrac{36}{n} n \amp\amp \blert{\text{Multiply boyh sides by}~n.}\\ 2.8125n \amp = 36 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by 2.8125.}}\\ n \amp = 12.8 \end{aligned}

We must first get the variable out of the denominator. \begin{aligned}[t] d^2(0.5547) \amp = \dfrac{1500}{d^2} d^2 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Multiply boyh sides by}~d^2.}\\ 0.5547d^2 \amp = 1500 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by 0.5547.}}\\ d^2 \amp = 2704.16 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Take square roots.}}\\ d \amp = 52 \end{aligned}

Find the constant of variation and the variation equation: y varies directly with the square of x, and y=100 when x=2.5.

solution.p: Because y varies directly with the square of x, we know that y=kx^2. We substitute the given values to find \begin{aligned}[t] 100 \amp = k(2.5)^2 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Solve for}~k.}\\ k \amp = \dfrac{100}{2.5^2} = 16 \end{aligned} The constant of variation is 16, and the variation equation is ~y=16x^2.

statement.p: Find the constant of variation and the variation equation: y varies inversely with the square of x, and y=4687.5 when x=0.16.

solution.p: Because y varies inversely with the square of x, we know that y=\dfrac{k}{x^2}. We substitute the given values to find \begin{aligned}[t] 4687.5 \amp = \dfrac{k}{0.16^2} \amp\amp \blert{\text{Solve for}~k.}\\ k \amp = 4687.5(0.16)^2=120 \end{aligned} The constant of variation is 120, and the variation equation is ~y=\dfrac{120}{x^2}.
